verses.kjv: Masters, give unto your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.
verses.web: Masters, give to your servants that which is just and equal, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
verses.ct: Masters, treat your servants with justice and fairness. Remember that you also have a Master in heaven.

verses.kjv: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;
verses.web: Continue steadfastly in prayer, watching in it with thanksgiving,
verses.ct: Be devoted to prayer, staying alert in it with a heart of thanksgiving.

verses.kjv: Withal praying also for us, that God would open unto us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:
verses.web: praying together for us also, that God may open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds,
verses.ct: Pray for us too, that God would open a door for us to share the message — the mystery of Christ — which is the very reason I'm in chains.

verses.kjv: That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
verses.web: that I may reveal it as I ought to speak.
verses.ct: Pray that I would proclaim it clearly, the way I'm supposed to.

verses.kjv: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.
verses.web: Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time.
verses.ct: Act wisely toward outsiders, and make the most of every opportunity.

verses.kjv: Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.
verses.web: Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each one.
verses.ct: Let your conversation always be gracious, seasoned with salt, so you'll know how to respond to everyone.

verses.kjv: All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you, who is a beloved brother, and a faithful minister and fellowservant in the Lord:
verses.web: All my affairs will be made known to you by Tychicus, the beloved brother, faithful servant, and fellow bondservant in the Lord.
verses.ct: Tychicus will tell you everything about how I'm doing. He's a dear brother, a faithful servant, and a fellow worker in the Lord.

verses.kjv: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;
verses.web: I am sending him to you for this very purpose, that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts,
verses.ct: I'm sending him to you for this exact reason — so he can learn how you're doing and encourage your hearts.

verses.kjv: With Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known unto you all things which are done here.
verses.web: together with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you everything that is going on here.
verses.ct: He's coming with Onesimus, a faithful and dear brother who is one of your own. Together they'll fill you in on everything that's happening here.

verses.kjv: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner saluteth you, and Marcus, sister’s son to Barnabas, (touching whom ye received commandments: if he come unto you, receive him;)
verses.web: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, greets you, and Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (concerning whom you received commandments, “if he comes to you, receive him”),
verses.ct: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends his greetings, and so does Mark, the cousin of Barnabas. You've already received instructions about Mark — if he comes to you, welcome him.

verses.kjv: And Jesus, which is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These only are my fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God, which have been a comfort unto me.
verses.web: and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for God’s Kingdom who are of the circumcision, men who have been a comfort to me.
verses.ct: Jesus, who goes by Justus, also sends greetings. These 3 are the only Jewish believers working with me for the kingdom of God, and they've been a real comfort to me.

verses.kjv: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, saluteth you, always labouring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verses.web: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, salutes you, always striving for you in his prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verses.ct: Epaphras, who is one of your own and a servant of Christ, sends his greetings. He's always wrestling in prayer for you, asking that you would stand firm, mature, and fully confident in everything God wills.

verses.kjv: For I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them that are in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.
verses.web: For I testify about him that he has great zeal for you, and for those in Laodicea, and for those in Hierapolis.
verses.ct: I can personally vouch for him — he works tirelessly for you and for the believers in Laodicea and Hierapolis.

verses.kjv: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.
verses.web: Luke the beloved physician and Demas greet you.
verses.ct: Luke, our dear doctor, and Demas send you their greetings.

verses.kjv: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.
verses.web: Greet the brothers who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly that is in his house.
verses.ct: Give my greetings to the brothers and sisters in Laodicea, and to Nymphas and the church that meets in his house.

verses.kjv: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
verses.web: When this letter has been read among you, cause it to be read also in the assembly of the Laodiceans, and that you also read the letter from Laodicea.
verses.ct: After this letter has been read to your congregation, make sure it gets read to the church in Laodicea as well. And be sure to read the letter that's coming from Laodicea.

verses.kjv: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.
verses.web: Tell Archippus, “Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you fulfill it.”
verses.ct: Tell Archippus, "Pay close attention to the ministry the Lord gave you, and make sure you carry it out fully."

verses.kjv: The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.web: The salutation of me, Paul, with my own hand: remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.ct: I, Paul, am writing this final greeting with my own hand. Remember that I'm in chains. Grace be with you. Amen.
